enhanced_by.reason: The get() method relies on the isInfinite() method to determine if the stream should be infinite or finite.
The get() method operates on an instance created by the Builder.build() method, which initializes the necessary state.
Both get() and iterator() methods return a stream or an iterator, respectively, which can be used to assert the correctness of the stream generation.
The toString() method provides a string representation of the FakeStream object, which can be used to assert the internal state after calling get().
